topic.title: Jack Applebaum & The State of the Tor Project

3_1CoVAt2jBzV4Na6nX3VG1JSfjS8fwse1Z9.body:
> z3r0c00l: You are obviously missing a point if you think that ZeroNet is created so that we could extend cancerous political debates here.

You are obviously missing the point if you think that in 2016 you can tell people what to say and what not to say.

> I'll rather hang out in some censored forum but where people appreciate things that don't hurt others. 

Then, until such censorship is hardcoded in ZeroTalk or enforced by someone who has the key to this site, then _you_ are the one who should go away.

> Considering terrorists equal and approving their actions just to be "politically correct" -  Not a price I am ready to pay for the "free speech".

See, I, for one, consider that even your moral comfort is a price I am ready to pay for _anyone_'s freedom of speech. Including –_especially_– the many who hate on me or disagree with me.

> [methodx](#comment_2_1CFhytwoGGPNqmueehPqotaf2iG9uxD98e): Just for the geeks which make up 0.001% of the population. For the other 99.99%, nothing has changed.

Unknown geeks like Turing, Nash, Snowden and Nietzsche have this habit of  changing _everything_ without you ever knowing it. You can't stop _them_ from happening.

> [trashish](#comment_21_1JpAsfEeBYdr8U3DtAzj8SyczL5Gx1EtQ9): Zeronet might need a decentralized reputation system... à la http://identi.fi/

Exactly what I have in mind. You can be anonymous, but there should be incentives to encourage you to have a good reputation.

> [captainplanet](#comment_9_1Ea7uVcuWTBiBAN1XCV7asaMaFBYPWbpAm): Identity is overrated. Usernames only help people hate each other more easily. And do silly childish things like stalk each other. There's no benefit to having a reputation or a username. They stop people from speaking their mind. They instill fear of being rejected. With a username you have a way for people to know it was you who said that dumb thing once, so you will think twice before saying something, and spontaneity is lost.

Can't care less.

> [captainplanet](#comment_12_1Ea7uVcuWTBiBAN1XCV7asaMaFBYPWbpAm): Nobody asked you to care.
 
Cute.

You can whine about it all you want. The one and only rule is still « may the best man win ». It's a syntactic game and you're not winning. You don't even seem to be enjoying yourself as much as I do.
